result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher John Klindt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher John Klindt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher John Klindt was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
_IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Concurrent to Minnesota sentence.

-Defendant in not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with known Drug Users unless through the course of treatment.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Attend MRT or equivalent.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
